commitResults.messageBody:
{why it needs to change} Rename the chatbot to differentiate it

{what is being done about it} Rename the chatbot to Ollie, and add the greeting and exit messages
Remove all traces of Duke
Level 0 rename greet exit

**Current Situation**
The chatbot only greets and exits

**Why it needs to change**
The chatbot should echo as well, and it has some personality

**What is being done about it**
* The chatbot returns the commands said by the user
* The chatbot greets and says bye
* The chatbot has cutomised message borders
* Chatbot personality: The chatbot has :) in the messages
Make the chatbot echo and have some personality

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ToDos, Events, Deadlines to inherit from Task
commitResults.messageBody:
**Current Situation**
* Use Inheritance to support multiple task types

  There are multiple types of tasks that have some similarity between them

**Why it needs to change**
* Use the concept of Inheritance to make it more organised

**What is being done about it**
* Implement classes Todo, Deadline and Event classes to inherit from a Task class.
Add subclasses Todo, Deadline, Event to inherit from Task
Track ToDos, Events, Deadlines
Test using the I/O redirection technique
Automated Text UI testing

commitResults.messageTitle: Exceptions to handle errors in user inputs

commitResults.messageBody: Create exception classes to handle errors in user inputs

commitResults.messageTitle: Handle errors based on user's input
commitResults.messageBody:
**Current Situation**
* Ollie does not handle all errors

**Why it needs to change**
* Ollie should let the user know what to do when the input lacks certain information

**What is being done about it**
* Each type of task throws a specific error to allow the user to use the correct command

**Why it is done that way**
* Use Exception classes and Error handling for more concise code

**Any other relevant info**
*
Handle errors based on user's input
Use ArrayList<Task>
Delete task from the list
Enumeration for TaskType
Test UIText pass
Save the tasks
Load stored tasks from ./data/olllie.txt

commitResults.messageTitle: Store the dates as MMM dd yyyy format
commitResults.messageBody:
**Current Situation**
The deadlines and dates are stored as strings.

**Why it needs to change**
The chatbot should understand 2/12/2019 1800 as 2nd of December 2019, 6pm, instead of treating it as just a String.

**What is being done about it**
* Store deadline dates as a java.time.LocalDateTime
* The user inputs the time in the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm
* The time is saved and loaded in the format MMM dd yyyy HH:mm

**Why it is done that way**
* It makes it clearer and more use to the user
Store the dates as MMM dd yyyy format

**Current Situation**
* The interactions with the user is in the Ollie class

**Why it needs to change**
* Refactor the code to extract out closely related code as classes.

**What is being done about it**
* Make a new class Ui for Ollie to interact with the user eg greeting, exit

**Why it is done that way**
* Utilise OOP principle

**Current Situation**
* The Ollie class is responsible for both parsing user commands and handling interactions

**Why it needs to change**
* Improve the maintainability and readability of the code.
* Parsing commands should be isolated from UI logic, adhering to the single responsibility principle.

**What is being done about it**
* Extract the parsing logic into a new Parser class that handles command interpretation.
* Move the respond method to the Ui class, allowing it to handle all user interactions, including command processing.

**Why it is done that way**
* Improves code organization and future extensibility
Additional OOP for Parser and Ui classes

**Current Situation**
* Classes are not organised into packages

**Why it needs to change**
* Improve code organization, readability, and maintainability

**What is being done about it**
* Place task-related classes into the ollie.task package.
* Keep the main classes in the ollie package.
* Group custom exception classes under the ollie.exception package.

**Why it is done that way**
* Enhance code modularity
* Ensure a cleaner project architecture
Divide classes into packages
Add gradle support

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests to Event and Exception classes
commitResults.messageBody:
**Current Situation**
* Classes are not tested using JUnit tests

**Why it needs to change**
* Ensure that the classes work correctly
* Ensure correct exceptions are thrown

**What is being done about it**
* Add JUnit tests for the classes to verify functionality.
* Add tests for custom exception classes to ensure correct behavior and messaging.

**Why it is done that way**
* Ensure code correctness
Add JUnit tests to Event and Exception classes

commitResults.messageTitle: Package the App as a JAR file
commitResults.messageBody:
**Current Situation**
* No JAR file created

**Why it needs to change**
* It is less easy to distribute without a JAR file

**What is being done about it**
* Package the app as an executable JAR file so that it can be distributed easily.

**Why it is done that way**
* Users can run the command java -jar "ollie.jar"
Package the App as a JAR file

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc comments to the classes and methods
commitResults.messageBody:
**Current Situation**
* Not all classes and methods have Javadoc comments

**Why it needs to change**
* The comments help to tell readers what the code does.

**What is being done about it**
* Let's add header comments to at least half of the non-private classes/methods.

**Why it is done that way**
* It makes the code more understandable to others.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak the code to comply with the coding standard
commitResults.messageBody:
Not all the code complies with the coding standard.

Let's change the code based on the Java coding standard here: https://se-education.org/guides/conventions/java/intermediate.html#conditionals

This ensures consistency across the codebase and better maintainability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add function to find a task by keyword
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no function to search for a task by a keyword.

Let's
* Add a command "find"
* Users can find the task(s) that contains the keyword
Add JavaDoc comments to the classes and methods
Tweak the code to comply with the coding standard
Add function to find a task by keyword

commitResults.messageTitle: Add a GUI to the Ollie chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
The user interacts with Ollie through the command line. Users should be able to interact with it through an application.

Let's
* use JavaFX in the application
* create  GUI to the Ollie chatbot
* refactor the code to allow the existing functions to work with the GUI
Add a GUI to the Ollie chatbot

commitResults.messageTitle: Use checkStyle to detect coding style violations.
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no automatic checks on whether the code violates the coding style.

Let's
* use Checkstyle to check the Java code against a set of style rules.
* change the current code to make sure it adheres to the rules
Use checkStyle to detect coding style violations.

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit the code based on Checkstyle
commitResults.messageBody:
Not all the code abide by the style rules.

Let's
* analyse the checkstyle output by running ./gradlew checkstyleMain checkstyleTest
* edit the code based on the style rules
Edit the code based on Checkstyle

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit the code based on code review
commitResults.messageBody:
There are some areas for improvement in terms of the Javadoc comments and method names.Some methods can be removed as they are not used.

Let's
- Make the Javadoc comments and method names more specific to the method
- Remove the method if the child class has the same method as the parent class
Edit the code based on code review

Not all assumptions in the code are identified using assertions.

Let's
* Use the assert feature to document important assumptions that should hold at various points in the code.

There is more to be improved in the readability and code practices.

Let's
* Remove redundant methods
* Edit the Javadoc comments to show the what and why
* Refer to the practices for code quality and make other necessary changes
* Test with  ./gradlew checkstyleMain checkstyleTest again

Only the find keywords function uses stream. Task parsing does not use streams.

Let's
* Use Java Streams to split and trim task data string components
* Improve the readability and maintainability of the parseTask method
Add Assertions

* practice merging the master branch on branch-A-Streams
* resolve the merge conflicts
Merge branch 'master' into branch-A-Streams

The switch statement does not abide by the coding style, causing the checkstyle test to fail.
* Let's change the indentation level of the switch and case statements
Set up Continuous Integration (CI)

It may be a hassle for users to type in the full commands.

Let's
* replace the action commands with alias eg "-f" for find
Add friendlier syntax for commands
